intro: Potamogeton rufescens subsp. rivularis, commonly known as the river pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater environments in North America. It has long, slender stems that are often branched and bear small, oval-shaped leaves arranged spirally along the stem. The plant produces tiny, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in spike-like structures. It thrives in slow-moving to still waters with muddy or sandy substrates. Potamogeton rufescens subsp. rivularis plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
